topic: Large Language Model Security Research

  entities:
    Rusheb Shah|Researcher
    Xuan Li|Researcher
    Anselm Paulus|Researcher
    Carlos E Jimenez|Researcher
    Zhenguo Hu|Researcher
    Chenyuan Yang|Researcher

    Richard Fang|Researcher

    WormGPT|Model

  proposition: "Do Anything Now" paper characterizes and evaluates jailbreak prompts on large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    "Do Anything Now"|DESCRIBES|jailbreak prompts
    "Do Anything Now"|EVALUATES|large language models

    entity-entity relationships:
    "Do Anything Now"|ANALYZES|large language models

  proposition: Rusheb Shah et al. proposed scalable and transferable black-box jailbreaks for language models via persona modulation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Rusheb Shah|PROPOSED|scalable black-box jailbreaks
    Rusheb Shah|PROPOSED|transferable black-box jailbreaks

    entity-entity relationships:
    Rusheb Shah|RESEARCHED|language models
    Rusheb Shah|DEVELOPED|persona modulation technique

  proposition: Xuan Li et al. introduced DeepInception technique to hypnotize large language models to become jailbreakers.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Xuan Li|INTRODUCED|DeepInception technique

    entity-entity relationships:
    DeepInception|TARGETS|large language models

  proposition: Anselm Paulus et al. developed AdvPrompter for fast adaptive adversarial prompting for large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Anselm Paulus|DEVELOPED|AdvPrompter
    AdvPrompter|CHARACTERISTIC|fast adaptive adversarial prompting

    entity-entity relationships:
    AdvPrompter|TARGETS|large language models

  proposition: Carlos E Jimenez et al. created SWE-bench to evaluate if language models can resolve real-world GitHub issues.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Carlos E Jimenez|CREATED|SWE-bench

    entity-entity relationships:
    SWE-bench|EVALUATES|language models
    SWE-bench|FOCUSES_ON|GitHub issues

  proposition: Zhenguo Hu et al. explored automated penetration testing using deep reinforcement learning.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhenguo Hu|EXPLORED|automated penetration testing

    entity-entity relationships:
    automated penetration testing|USES|deep reinforcement learning

  proposition: Chenyuan Yang et al. developed WhiteFox, a white-box compiler fuzzing tool empowered by large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Chenyuan Yang|DEVELOPED|WhiteFox
    WhiteFox|CHARACTERISTIC|white-box compiler fuzzing tool

    entity-entity relationships:
    WhiteFox|POWERED_BY|large language models

  proposition: Jincheng Wang et al. created LLMIF for augmenting large language models to fuzz IoT devices.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Jincheng Wang|CREATED|LLMIF

    entity-entity relationships:
    LLMIF|AUGMENTS|large language models
    LLMIF|TARGETS|IoT devices

  proposition: Ruijie Meng et al. proposed large language model guided protocol fuzzing.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ruijie Meng|PROPOSED|large language model guided protocol fuzzing

  proposition: Yinlin Deng et al. demonstrated that large language models can be zero-shot fuzzers for deep-learning libraries.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yinlin Deng|DEMONSTRATED|zero-shot fuzzing capability

    entity-entity relationships:
    large language models|FUZZ|deep-learning libraries

  proposition: Xiaoyue Ma et al. used large language models to unveil hidden bugs in Matter IoT device specifications.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Xiaoyue Ma|USED|large language models

    entity-entity relationships:
    large language models|IDENTIFIES|hidden bugs
    hidden bugs|LOCATED_IN|Matter IoT device specifications

  proposition: Saad Ullah et al. conducted a comprehensive evaluation of LLMs' ability to identify and reason about security vulnerabilities.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Saad Ullah|CONDUCTED|comprehensive evaluation of LLMs

    entity-entity relationships:
    Saad Ullah|EVALUATED|security vulnerabilities

  proposition: OpenAI published a report on influence and cyber operations.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    OpenAI|PUBLISHED|report on influence and cyber operations

  proposition: Richard Fang et al. showed that teams of LLM agents can exploit zero-day vulnerabilities.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Richard Fang|DEMONSTRATED|LLM agents exploit capabilities

    entity-entity relationships:
    LLM agents|EXPLOIT|zero-day vulnerabilities

  proposition: Xiangmin Shen et al. developed PentestAgent for incorporating LLM agents in automated penetration testing.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Xiangmin Shen|DEVELOPED|PentestAgent

    entity-entity relationships:
    PentestAgent|INCORPORATES|LLM agents
    PentestAgent|SUPPORTS|automated penetration testing

  proposition: Dan Ristea et al. created an AI Cyber Risk Benchmark for automated exploitation capabilities.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Dan Ristea|CREATED|AI Cyber Risk Benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    AI Cyber Risk Benchmark|EVALUATES|automated exploitation capabilities

  proposition: Polra Victor Falade analyzed the threat landscape of ChatGPT, FraudGPT, and WormGPT in social engineering attacks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Polra Victor Falade|ANALYZED|threat landscape

    entity-entity relationships:
    Polra Victor Falade|STUDIED|ChatGPT
    Polra Victor Falade|STUDIED|FraudGPT
    Polra Victor Falade|STUDIED|WormGPT
    ChatGPT|INVOLVED_IN|social engineering attacks
    FraudGPT|INVOLVED_IN|social engineering attacks
    WormGPT|INVOLVED_IN|social engineering attacks
